alert.note: Alert for Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MASON, ROBERTSON, SOUTHEASTERN BROWN AND SOUTHWESTERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Fairview, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Washington, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Lewisburg, Mount Olivet, Dover, Germantown, Sardis, Blue Licks Battlefield, Murphysville, Burika, Alhambra, Bradysville, Mays Lick, Mitchells Mill, Rectorville, Peed and Helena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
